intro: Jussiaea nervosa var. glaberrima, commonly known as the smoothleaf jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Peru. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and covered with a smooth, glabrous surface. This species thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in wetlands or along stream banks.
